website_summaries.verdict: If you need an ultracompact camera for your pocket or purse, strongly consider the Canon PowerShot SD780 IS.
pros: very good photo and HD movie quality
cons: No optical zoom in Movie mode

customer_reviews.title: Delivered rapidly. As described. Happy.
customer_reviews.text: This order was delivered on time. My wife loves this discontinued model. This is the third one she's had. The screen on the first went blank after several years. The second was accidentally dropped in water. Her girlfriend shook it off and turned it on and the lens extended. Then it shorted out fatally, of course. FYI, when any electronic equipment gets wet, you should immediately turn it off and remove any batteries so the device can't short-circuit. Then let it dry out for several days. There are several drying methods detailed online.
customer_reviews.author: James Poore

customer_reviews.title: Great value camera
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera back in 2009, and would have to say that it's among the best value point-and-shoot cameras I have ever owned. It's simplicity and affordability makes it perfect for the average user. However, as with all electronics, technology moves fast and this one quickly became outdated after a few years. For the non-camera savvy user, I always recommend this camera and its successor models.
customer_reviews.author: alan

customer_reviews.title: 5 years old and still as good as new
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera in 2009 when it first came out. I am no photographer, just someone who likes good quality pictures/videos. Mostly of my kids activities. As for pictures, the SD780 nails it almost every time. Low light, bright light, action shots no problem. The videos are just as good as I have not touched my very nice Canon camcorder in years. My iPhone takes ok spur of the moment photos but when I know a photo op is going to occur I grab my PowerShot. It has been exposed to all sorts of weather elements, beaches, dust, etc and is as good as the day as I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Kingman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent little camera.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my wife who is a plein air artist. Cameras without optical viewfinders are terrible in bright sunlight, so this is one of the few viewfinder cameras still available. Works very well, no complaints at all. The seller, Gerald, was excellent as well.
customer_reviews.author: Wave addict

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic little camera
customer_reviews.text: We bought this camera for our son for his graduation; I was so impressed with it that I bought one for myself! The instruction book is loaded with clear directions on all the many, many features of this little powerhouse. It takes beautiful, clear pictures and great video! The (rechargable) battery life is terrific. My son's roommate is constantly borrowing it for projects, etc.. My friend went on a trip to Spain with a $1200. camera, her traveling companion had this camera. When they returned she went through all their pictures to put a book together and was amazed that she couldn't see a difference in quality between the photos. Very highly recommended!!
customer_reviews.author: dolphins

customer_reviews.title: Amazing little camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera and received it (two days later) the day we were leaving for a 3 week drive from Texas to the West Coast. No time to read the instructions, but turns out it is very intuitive and easily figured out. It worked like a champ, staying charged forever, taking beautiful clear pictures in any light. Not super fast, but much better than my old fuji (that I really liked). My husband has an SLR and I had my tiny. Mine was so compact and reliable, we used it the most. Holds 8gig memory card and was easy to download to my netbook using a cardreader.
customer_reviews.author: Liz P.

customer_reviews.title: Small and cute, but didn’t last a long time. Was not reliable
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for a year, then stopped working. I even got a replacement battery for it, but it didn’t turn on and load correctly. I lost some photos I’ll never be able to get back. Pros: small and fits in an altoid tin. I like the color mode—the one where you just have one color show up.
customer_reviews.author: HB

customer_reviews.title: Perfect.
customer_reviews.text: This camera is perfect. It takes great pictures during the day, and is wonderful for travelers, since it's about the size of a deck of cards. Mine is at least four years old, and has been carried, dropped, and used on three continents and in sixteen countries with no problems. Admittedly, it's not the best for taking pictures at night unless you're willing to mess with the settings a lot, but few point-and-shoot digital cameras are. If you're on a budget, but want a great camera that's easy to travel with (and isn't showy enough to get you mugged in questionable foreign neighborhoods) choose this one.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany D. Steffey

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera
customer_reviews.text: I've had this camera over 3 years now and it's still everything I could have hoped for. I consider myself an amateur and mainly use it for taking pictures/video of my son, family vacations, that sort of thing. I love the small size and ease of use (even my 4 year old can take decent pictures with it). I keep it inwhen not using it and that has saved it from many drops. Battery life is still good after all this time. Like I said, I'm an amateur, but I think the pictures and video come out great especially considering the price of this camera.
customer_reviews.author: wxyzzzzzzzz

customer_reviews.title: OUTSTANDING!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is one outstanding camera in every way you can imagine. But then, I have come to expect nothing less from the good folks at Cannon. Despite what some of the more negative reviews say. The pictures from this camera are magnificent! (and I have seen Pixs from other brands of point and shoots that are certanly less then satisfying.) This is the first camera I've had with face recognition. So I was impressed when it would detect human faces on the images on the TV screen. It's size is great! And (as the saying goes) I even like the color!!! I whole heartedly recommend this camera!!! To anyone! At any price!
customer_reviews.author: Roy A. Mayfield

customer_reviews.title: Perfect mini camera
customer_reviews.text: We were looking for an ultra compact camera for travel, something you could use to take some quick shots and then stow away. Best thing about this camera, aside from the usual specs discussed in the other reviews, is it has a viewfinder. The newer version of this camera, and for that matter most compact point n shoots coming out now, don't have a viewfinder. There are many scenes outdoors especially at the beach or in the snow where the screen view just doesn't make it. Very pleased with the purchase. This is my first Canon product, my previous digital cameras have been Sony. Quality seems very good. We'll see how it holds up.
customer_reviews.author: yoyochi

customer_reviews.title: best digital used to date
customer_reviews.text: The only small digital I have found with a viewfinder--its best feature. This is the primary reason I bought it. My photos are much more professional and I don't have to guess at what I am framing, like so many digital cameras with only the LCD. By using only the viewfinder, I can get twice as many photos as with the LCD. It is extremely lightweight and fits in my smallest pocket. The zoom, located on the shutter button, is much easier to use than the position on my last camera. The only drawback is that the battery has to be removed to be recharged, so buy two batteries and keep the extra charged up. DD
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 5 Star with proviso
customer_reviews.text: Great take along camera. No bulging pockets or big case to worry about. Takes great pictures with video feature to boot. One problem I found (for me) is when zoomed out fully and then you later want to print a 8X10, the finer details will be pixelated but not noticeable with 4x6 prints. However, in fairness, this could be an IS issue at full zoom(?) or photographer (me) trying to do too much image correction. Will have to try more 8X10's with no zooming or image correction. Megapixel size should be enough for 8x10's so not sure what problem might be (and, yes, image quality is set to maximum in menu).
customer_reviews.author: Bat

customer_reviews.title: Excellent compact camera
customer_reviews.text: Simply put this is a great compact camera. It's compact and lightweight, smaller than most in this segment so portability is a non issue. It doesn't feature the gimmicks of other cameras, but it's very well designed and menus are easy to navigate. With one hand a user can turn on the camera and go right into snapping photos. As for image quality, again it's among the best in the segment. Image quality is very good with great color and good white balance. Without question, there are better cameras, but they will be significantly more expensive and much bulkier. For what this camera is designed to do it is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: MaWeiTao

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for me
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this camera on 9/17/2018 and received it promptly on 9/24/2018. It was exactly as advertised. It's small, easy to use, ready to go with the battery charged and a fresh memory card. The seller said there were a few minor scratches, but I couldn't find any. The picture quality is excellent. The seller told the truth about everything, and I couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Anita L.

customer_reviews.title: A Great Little Camera
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one of these for my wife, I have Canon Rebel XT for myself, but I found that I was borrowing her little camera more and more it's so convenient and easy to use and I didn't have to lug a bag around, did I mention the fantastic quality of the photos? The Rebel XT is a wonderful camera and I use it and depend on it a lot, but I can't slide it into my shirt pocket for those, "just in case" shots that I use to miss. I was fortunate and got a good deal on a refurbished one, but it would have been worth the list price. Thanks Amazon and Canon.
customer_reviews.author: A. R. Kushmir

customer_reviews.title: excelent but  seems to be fragile
customer_reviews.text: I had a Canon PS 710IS and decided to change to a SD 780IS due to the tiny size and portability Pros: Tiny size ans easy to carry Good quality movies Fast shutter - allows to take more than 2 pictures in 2 seconds Excelent battery life - taking more than 200 pictures with one full charge Contras: Seems to be fragile - don't drop it poor optical zoom - should be at least 4 x do not use rechargeable common batteries Diffcicult to use special effects and faetures For my amateur and sporadical use due to the excelent portability this camera fits.
customer_reviews.author: Marcio Luiz Goulart

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little camera!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this Canon Power Shot SD780 through Amazon. It was a refurbished camera at Beach Camera. The camera seemed to be a brand new camera and works perfect. Love the red color and the view finder is handy when it is really sunny. I had a Canon Power Shot SD630 and it was awesome but I lost it 4 months ago and it was really depressing not to have it with me always. The SD780 is close to the SD630 and I am very happy with it. Nice and tiny to use and carry where ever I go. After looking at so many cameras, I just seem to love the Canons the best!
customer_reviews.author: Melody Spafford

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for those times you need a quick picture
customer_reviews.text: I'd been using my iPhone for pictures of whiteboard sessions around the office. I'd take them and send them to SharePoint. (A lot of work goes into some of those sessions, eh?) The quality of an iPhone snap isn't the greatest. I looked at reviews for small, dense cameras at a reasonable price and this one bubbled up to the top. I've been using it more than a month and it takes an excellent snap. No blurry stuff in the results. Great lighting. Very easy to manage photos, including uploading, posting and deleting from the camera. The best part is I can slip it in a pocket until I need it. Very handy!
customer_reviews.author: Glenn A. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great Snapshot Camera!
customer_reviews.text: This camera is great for the purpose I bought it for. It takes great snapshots, is easy to take with me wherever I go (it is very small, fit's in a shirt pocket), and it also takes great video. My only complaint is sometimes action shots look a little blurry, but those are easily fixed, or I just take another picture. The small size makes it a little difficult to take extended amounts of video, putting it on a tripod would be advised if you plan to take more than 5 minutes of video (which isn't what I got it for.) Great little camera, what I've come to expect from Canon.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Young

customer_reviews.title: Good camera.
customer_reviews.text: You have to be careful not to get any sand or dirt particles in the retractable lens or you will ruin the camera. Other then that they are awesome cameras! I have had 8 of them. ( have ruined 6 as explained above) But they are cheap on ebay right now so worth the through away mentality.
customer_reviews.author: Stillraining

customer_reviews.title: Freaking awesome
customer_reviews.text: Tiny little camera, big time quality. It's smaller than most cell phones I've ever seen, but better than some of the larger model cameras I've seen. The zoom, only being at 3x, isn't that impressive, but even when fully zoomed, in a van, going down a bumpy road in the middle of nowhere iraq, the image will still come out crystal clear with awesome 12.1 mp definition. It's the best point and shoot camera I've ever seen and in my opinion canon is the best quality camera maker for durablility and quality of pictures. Highly recommended camera.
customer_reviews.author: Banditface

customer_reviews.title: Fine.  Just fine.
customer_reviews.text: I use it for Point and Shoot. It's small, easy to handle, looks cool, takes great pictures, has resolution good enough for 8x10 prints. I love it. The only shortcoming is the flash. It's way too weak for anything but the closest flash shots. Oh, I bought a three battery pack from Amazon to go with it and always have a couple of batteries with me cause nothing sucks more like having a dead battery when you want to snap a photo. The cheapy, no-name batteries I bought (like 3 for $10) are just as good as the "Canon" battery.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Palangian

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera
customer_reviews.text: The portability of this camera cannot be beat! However, do not expect SLR grade pics with it. Its a point and shoot, and really can do quite a bit. But its not going to give you the best picture quality you've ever seen. Also, the flash is fairly weak, probably due to the small size and power limitations. I was also impressed with the speed. Others have said its slow, but I disagree. From power button press to picture taken is less than 2 seconds. Overall, a great camera for slipping into a pocket and carrying with you.
customer_reviews.author: mruseless

customer_reviews.title: Noisy in low light; controls could be bigger
customer_reviews.text: The video is pretty noisy in normal indoor lighting. Outside in daylight it looks great. Photos don't suffer from noise as much as video since you can use a flash. The controls on the back are small and not raised enough for me to operate accurately without using my fingernails. The model I got has a dead pixel in the sensor. This shows up as a very small white speck on photos (which is really not noticeable) but on videos it becomes a very noticeable red dot. I'm sure Canon will fix it but it's a pain to send to them and I have to pay shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Good camera - not amazing
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a name-brand camera for less than $200 that would be easy to use, have image stabilization, and shoot video. This one is as I hoped - starts up quickly, is fairly easy to select a picture mode, and durable, with a few downsides: - it doesn't always shoot the picture with the right lighting, even when I have it on the right setting or even auto - similar to this, it takes much better photos of people with light complexions than darker tones, no matter what setting you put it on - the video recorder has terrible audio capabilities Next time, I might just spend the extra $50 to get something a little "higher" end.
customer_reviews.author: M. Simon

customer_reviews.title: Favorite canon camera
customer_reviews.text: Top canon quality, fair price, lasts forever. My favorite camera ever, using more than 9 years and it works as a charm. 5/5
customer_reviews.author: dogangulen

customer_reviews.title: Just when you think they can't make it any smaller!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera (SD780IS) because my son broke my SD600. When I got the SD780 IS, I was amazed that this camera is even smaller or I should say thinner than my SD600. SD780 is about 20% thinner than SD600. However, SD600 feels sturdier than the SD780 IS. The only 2 features that SD780 tops SD600 are the HD video/audio and higher resolution. I think the picture quality for both model is about the same. Also SD600 is made in Japan where as SD780 is made in China. If you don't care about the HD video/audio, I would definitely recommend SD600 as a better buy.
customer_reviews.author: Philip C.

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera for travelling
customer_reviews.text: I previously purchased this model couple of years ago. I accidentally dropped it in my carport and ran over it with my car. I can't see a camera screen in sunlight, so I loved the view finder. I brought it to a local camera store and it couldn't be repaired nor replaced. I checked the Amazon site and found a used one identical to the one I had. It is in great condition and I am so happy I have it. Miss TC
customer_reviews.author: Miss T.C.

customer_reviews.title: Canon PowerShot SD780IS
customer_reviews.text: If you want a small quailty camer then consider the Canon PowerShot SD780IS. We researched this item for days and found we could lay our hands on one at a electronics store. The problem was the price which was much higher that Amazon's price. This came has a metal body, not the cheaper plastic material found on most cameras this size. The picture quailty is amazing. It is easy to set up and easy to take pictures.Some folks may not like the color---we do as we refer to it as "the little red camera".
customer_reviews.author: Bill A. Belt

customer_reviews.title: Good camera
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my daughter. She uses it all the time and it takes great pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: A great buy!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this camera for a week and so far it is great. I bought it for taking very close-zoomed pictures of products I make. Quality of pictures is excellent once you figure out the right settings. I highly recommend this if you are an amateur interested in doing more with your camera. The only drawbacks are: The settings are somewhat confusing and take time to figure out (but they do a great job and offer alot of manipulation for this price range) The video quality is not as good as others have indicated. Its fine, but nothing amazing.
customer_reviews.author: MIBH

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Seller & Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I just wanted to take a minute to write an incredible review for you. I had to send you an email and you responded immediately to my question. Thank you. The camera was a gift for my fiancee and she absolutely loves it. It's tiny tiny tiny (in a very good way). It turns on almost instantly and it takes incredible photos for being such a small portable camera. She is happy to be rejoined with her beloved Elph camera. Thank you!!
customer_reviews.author: ARM

customer_reviews.title: It's smaller than I thought, but i still like it.
customer_reviews.text: This is one solid piece of work and i feel as if it was built to last. I bought mine used so it had a few scratches on it, and the shutter wouldn't open so i had to use my fingers to sort of pry them open. It takes rather good pictures, and it's decent in low light. I would reccomend this to anyone who is looking for a very portable, rough camera that takes pretty good pictures. Video isn't too bad and the battery life is pretty amazing. I love this tiny camera.
customer_reviews.author: Yang Pao Cheng

customer_reviews.title: The digital camera I have had. I bought it almost 3 years ago.
customer_reviews.text: Hello, I bought this camera on August 2010. This camera has fallen to the floor many times. It has received salt water and sand while my family is shooting photos on the beach every year. After all the camera is still working in the same way as the first day we received it from Amazon. It is very easy to use. If you don't want complications, and just want take photos, choose this camera. Regards, Alberto Morillo
customer_reviews.author: Alberto Morillo Rdguez

customer_reviews.title: Nice Camera with HD video.
customer_reviews.text: My SD750 was dropped to the floor and the lens cover is broken. So, I got a chance to look around for a new camera. It comes down to ZS3, SD780IS, SD960IS, but end up with SD780IS mainly because size, capability HD, good indoor shot quality, and the price is pretty good. The result is great, better photo quality compared to SD750, but video quality is much better. And it felt very small in hands, and fit very comfortably in jean's pocket. And one bonus I got is I can reuse almost everything from SD750.
customer_reviews.author: Wen-chun Cheng

customer_reviews.title: phenomenal robust tiny camera.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this camera for years around the world, hiking, site touring, and also documenting events using a handlebar mount. Phenomenal clarity and quality, but dropped it in the muck once too often. The original tried to live, but I replaced, and glad i did, awaiting more adventures with this tiny workhorse camera.
customer_reviews.author: Rugby Prop

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Camera!
customer_reviews.text: THis small camera is powerful to take vivid photo and video. Just simply amazing. It's simple to operate. Truly point and shoot! and the result after to upload it to your computer is just fantastic. When I viewed my photos I was just amazed how clear and vivid my photos are. The videos are the same, the HD is just as clear as much as today's HD camcorders. I would recommend this to your love ones and teens would love this. Check this out. [...]
customer_reviews.author: Jags Fan

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera
customer_reviews.text: I used this Power Shot for my appraisal business taking pictures of houses every day, the first one purchased 2010 lasted through 6 years of use and abuse (dropped to many times) so when it finally bit the dust I purchased another!!!!
customer_reviews.author: MidnightGroove

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera, purchased this second as a gift!
customer_reviews.text: Probably one of the best cameras I ever purchased. I bought this when it first came out, solid camera, great options & killer video. I ordered a second one as a present for my mom when my son was born, perfect choice for a point & shoot. It shares a common caveat with all point & shoot cameras, the video gets grainy in low light.
customer_reviews.author: Matty

customer_reviews.title: great camera
customer_reviews.text: I got this camera for my daughter who put her SD900 through the riggers of 4 years of college....it finally gave up...This is a fine replacement smaller and now has HD video........another good point is Canon has kept the same ...very good.... menu to set up the camera.......She really like the size...thinner than most and a fine picture....and the price from the Amazon Holiday period was $50 cheaper than anyone else....$149.00
customer_reviews.author: N. R. Von Staden

customer_reviews.title: Tiny. easy, fun. This is the perfect camera!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something very small that would be very easy to operate and easy to cart around with me wherever I go. This camera is smaller than my cell phone!! It is super easy. I took it out of the box, charged the battery and started taking pictures within seconds. It has a good zoom, and the auto-focus works very well. You literally just point and shoot. This is the coolest camera I have ever owned. I couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Shoppinurse

customer_reviews.title: Hit or Miss. Maybe I got a lemon?
customer_reviews.text: Quality picture for a P&S and felt solid. However the pre-set option and video didn't work. The macro setting was all blurry, water fall setting was also blurry, the video had major lag on it when I uploaded to pc, mac pretty much on every device I owned. I even changed SD cards, thinking it is the card's fault, still the same result.
customer_reviews.author: Darkeyes

customer_reviews.title: A great buy that has lasted me for well over 5 ...
customer_reviews.text: A great buy that has lasted me for well over 5 six years and still runs as though I bought it yesterday. I believe my purchase was in 2012
customer_reviews.author: Nina Gaza

customer_reviews.title: Not the same as the Original
customer_reviews.text: Farrrr from the Canon SD7801S purchsed from Best Buy. Some features are not in this and the picture quality is poor. Seems to be a knock off version though it says Canon. I purchased the same model from Best Buy and my husband envied it so I bought him this for his Birthday, disappointing! Buy the real deal from an electronic store you will be glad you did.
customer_reviews.author: Island Chic

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Snapshot Camera
customer_reviews.text: You really can't beat the size of this series of Canon snapshot cameras. It fits in your pocket without weighing you down or bulging, which makes it great to take to parties or a night on the town. I've had older generations, and am just as satisfied with this one. I filmed a space shuttle launch with the video feature of this camera, and the sound and video quality were much better than I had expected. Snapshot still photos are excellent.
customer_reviews.author: somerandomguy03

customer_reviews.title: totally portable
customer_reviews.text: this camera is tiny and the display on the lcd is grainy. the picture quality is about the same as any canon point and shoot. my girlfriend likes it because its flashy and she can show it off. and again its tiny. i would much rather have an slr, but for people who just want to take a bunch of pictures to show your vacation off, or to snap a couple quick shots of some weirdo walking by just for fun, this camera is pretty nice.
customer_reviews.author: Z. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Nice, small camera
customer_reviews.text: Although I wouldn't buy this camera NOW, when I got it, I felt it was a very good choice. The reason I got it makes choices limited and that is that it has an optical viewfinder. I have not treated the camera kindly and it has stood up to the abuse well. I mainly use the pix for posting on Facebook and the quality is fine, as are the features.
customer_reviews.author: Elisabeth Bingham

customer_reviews.title: Canon PowerShot SD780 IS
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Canon PowerShot SD780IS camera and was amazed at its performance, for Canon's smallest camera. I bought a refurbished camera and it was in good shape, then bought another one to carry with me all the time. The camera's are a few years old, but still work as new.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmer

customer_reviews.title: Canon Powershot 780IS
customer_reviews.text: This little Gem packs power and portability and is amazing! I love this little guy! One of the smallest cameras in the World! It's Incredible! Goes with me where I need it! Pocket portability! A true powerhouse!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Guadagnino

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Pocket Camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera after some extensive shopping around to go on a backpacking trip to the grand canyon and yosemite. It's not an SLR, so anything beyond your standard photos you may find something lacking. However, the image quality is truly extraordinary for such a small camera. I've taken pictures alongside someone with an SLR and for your basic pictures (good lighting, no zoom needed), the image quality was just as good. If it got broken today, I would definitely buy this camera again. I've been using it for several months and have never been unhappy with what this camera has done and I haven't found anything I truly dislike.
customer_reviews.author: eglen84

customer_reviews.title: Good camera
customer_reviews.text: Fine little camera, pocket size with optical viewfinder, limited zoom (hey, it's a little camera) replaceable battery and memory card.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Gates

customer_reviews.title: I like it. I bought it used with scratches for ...
customer_reviews.text: I like it. I bought it used with scratches for $40. My regret is that after I bought it, I saw a 14MP version in pristine condition for $40.
customer_reviews.author: Charnsit

customer_reviews.title: Canon Elph
customer_reviews.text: The Elph is a great camera, that is why I wanted a second one. Blue Sky Trader evidently did not know the camera had a problem, therefore I will give him a 5 Star Rating, the speed of the transaction was awesome. I have an Elph but wanted a second one for my sister, and was happy to get it. He was very gracious in his email and set my mind at ease. Thanks hopefully I can find a used elph. Thanks to Amazon and Blue Sky Trader.
customer_reviews.author: Helen Grayce Ezarik

customer_reviews.title: Fine if you want a small camera
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera for my wife in April '09 so that it would be easier to keep in her purse when needed. It is indeed small and easy to carry around. This is our third Canon Powershot camera. I must say that the first one we owned took better indoor, zoomed pictures. This camera is awful when zoomed to the optical limit of 3x. (indoors) Outside the shots are fine. The HD video is impressive for a small camera. I just can't get over the BLURRRRRR every time a shot is taken indoors. Hmmmmm, I thought his had that new feature called Motion Detection Technology. If only I could get back my Canon 2MP camera. Oh well!
customer_reviews.author: sa

customer_reviews.title: Great small camera
customer_reviews.text: Does everything it says it will and does it well. This is a great camera for close to medium range shots, when traveling you can take great stills and very good HD video. Only thing I would fix would be the ability to zoom optically when in video mode. If you want a small camera that captures HD video .... buy this one SD780IS. Got this from Amazon $[...] bucks cheaper than any other retailer or on-line vendor $[...]... WOW!!! Also bought the 8gb sdhc class 6 memory card.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Great for Outdoors
customer_reviews.text: This camera is great for using outdoors. It takes SLR quality pictures (if not blown up too much)when used with the natural lighting of the sun. When it comes to the inside, well, it all depends on your skill level. If you stick with the auto feature, then you will need to take several pictures as about 20% or so will not be what you want. Lots of lighting problems, as well as shutter problems on the auto feature. BUT, if you customize your set-up (Iso etc.) to fit your needs, it works much better. The HD video is great and looks wonderful on a 42" LCD HD TV. Great value!!!
customer_reviews.author: S. Tudor

customer_reviews.title: Canon PowerShot SD780IS 12.1 MP Digital Camera-Love it

customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera for taking pictures of our products. You don't have any settings to monkey around with, it works great on auto, all you do is point and click, and presto you have a crystal clear image, especially any lettering. customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, autofocus died within a year from purchase
customer_reviews.text: Just about a year later (I purchased March 30 of last year), the autofous died without any warning. My previous canon powershot camera died with the similar reason too. I called Canon but obviously it was just a day beyond the warrenty and my camera was not eligible for repair. I tried to ask the rep about the reason underlying spontaneous dying of autofocus, which seems happening two times in a row in my case, and was told that he had never heard about this kind of problem. With such a poor durability, no matter how fancy it appears, I will never trust canon any more and will definitely not buying from them ever again

To me, a viewfinder in bright sunlight is essential, and this little jewel has one that zooms with the lens. Get this baby as I did before Canon drops it for one of its non-viewfinder upgrades.

The lens leaves a lot to be desired for in low light conditions. Outdoors or in good lighting the camera shines. The HD video is a nice addition, and the quality is fair. Unfortunately there is almost no compression on the videos so you cannot record for very long unless you have a 8 gig SD card (or larger).

customer_reviews.title: Adjustments are easy.
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful point & shoot camera for taking quick photos. Very easy to use.

customer_reviews.title: Simple and Powerful

It has a lot of built in smarts, so that it adjusts as you focus to shoot the scene. It also has some advanced features that I am still learning to use. Great "little" camera. customer_reviews.title: Older buyers - you'll really like this camera.

customer_reviews.title: RIP Old Friend
customer_reviews.text: This camera was in my pocket for 100 weeks of culinary school, three years of catering events, every football and basketball game (she was a cheerleader) and event through the last two years of my daughter's high school, including her taking it to school with her, and numerous family occasions. It finally succumbed to abuse and died after at least its third drop from the top bunk onto a wood floor at summer camp. It was a good pal for those years and took some awesome pictures. I miss you, little buddy! If you can find this camera new grab it. It'll serve you well. I actually pre-ordered it here on Amazon before it was available.

product_meta.title: Canon PowerShot SD780IS 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.5-inch LCD (Silver)
product_meta.description:
Color:SilverFROM THE MANUFACTURER


It may be the slimmest Digital ELPH Canon has ever created, but the impact couldn’t be bigger. The PowerShot SD780 IS Digital ELPH captivates the senses with bold saturated colors and a daringly original design that matches the intensity of Canon’s most innovative camera technology. Even when picture-taking conditions seem pretty unforgiving, you’ve got Canon on your side. So the shots you used to miss are the images you’ll now be sharing, and the movies you never took before will be HD unforgettable. 

PowerShot SD780 IS Highlights 

12.1-megapixel resolution, 3x optical zoom lens with Optical Image Stabilizer
Canon’s commitment to innovation defines the excitement of the PowerShot SD780 IS Digital ELPH. 12.1-megapixel resolution is more than a number, it’s your cutting-edge link to the outstanding clarity and quality you’ve always wanted in your images. Think bold and big, because razor-sharp oversized prints are a breeze. Get the picture? It’s absolutely brilliant. 



The PowerShot SD780 IS Digital ELPH has a 3x optical zoom lens that makes it easy to get the inspiring, emotive close-ups that will make your images lasting keepsakes. This magnificent lens gives you the power to shoot distant subjects with razor-sharp precision and stunning lifelike color. So you can brilliantly capture a closer shot of a landscape, or a child’s big smile. 

The PowerShot SD780 IS Digital ELPH is equipped with Canon’s acclaimed Optical Image Stabilizer Technology that automatically detects and corrects camera shake--one of the leading causes of fuzzy or blurred shots. Even when zoomed in, you can get the steady, crisp, brilliant images you’ll be proud to shoot and share. And Canon’s Optical Image Stabilizer Technology is so convenient to use. It functions perfectly with or without a flash. 

HD movie shooting capability plus HDMI output
The PowerShot SD780 IS Digital ELPH lets you record video in beautiful high definition (1280 x 720 pixels). The camera also makes it easy to enjoy HD movies (and still photos) on your HDTV with a mini-HDMI connector for direct connection to a high-definition monitor. You’ll enjoy the HD experience with no degradation of image or audio in the signal, plus the ability to display up to 130 still images at once. 

Smart AUTO intelligently selects the proper settings
Just set the Canon PowerShot SD780 IS Digital ELPH to Smart AUTO and you’re ready for maximum enjoyment from your picture taking every time. It’s a relaxing and satisfying way to shoot because you can completely concentrate on your subject knowing that the camera has the technical details covered. Advanced Canon technology intelligently analyzes your situation and shooting conditions. Then it automatically selects an appropriate setting from 18 specially defined settings. So whether you’re photographing flowers, a captivating sunset, or your friends at the park, you can be confident that you’re getting dramatic, memorable images. 

Shooting Modes 
Advanced presets for the best possible photos under certain conditions. With 20 Shooting Modes, you’re ready for whatever shot comes your way. 

2.5-inch PureColor LCD II and wide viewing angle
The PowerShot SD780 IS Digital ELPH gives you a large 2.5-inch LCD screen for excellent control when framing your shots. Canon’s PureColor LCD II offers spectacular color, resolution and contrast even when viewed at an angle. The screen is highly durable and easy to see in any light with a scratch-resistant, anti-reflective coating. It also features Night Display for easy viewing in low light--a perfect feature for gathering friends and family around to see your images. 

A World of Advantages with Canon’s Technology 

The DIGIC 4 image processor has evolved Face Detection Technology that tracks the faces of moving subjects and lets the shooter enter the frame seamlessly with the Face Detection Self-Timer. 

DIGIC 4 Image Processor 
Canon’s most advanced image processor, DIGIC 4, delivers evolved Face Detection Technology that keeps every face in every photo looking its very best. The technology finds and tracks the faces of moving subjects until you’re ready to shoot, then delivers perfect focus. In addition, exposure, flash and white balance are compensated, so that faces exhibit natural skin tones and backgrounds are properly exposed. 

iSAPS Technology is an entirely original scene-recognition technology developed for digital cameras by Canon. Using an internal database of thousands of different photos, iSAPS works with the advanced DIGIC 4 Image Processor to improve focus speed and accuracy, as well as exposure and white balance. 

A Face Detection Self-Timer automatically detects an increase in the number of faces and makes the appropriate adjustments. For instance, to include the photographer’s face in a group shot, there’s no need to rush in. Just put the camera on a stand or tripod, specify Face Detection Self-Timer, and the camera will wait for the photographer’s face to get on-camera before it takes the shot. Motion Detection tracks moving subjects in a much larger range, and the Servo AF retains focus on a moving subject after the shutter button is pressed halfway--allowing you to wait for the perfect shot without refocusing. 

Intelligent Contrast Correction
DIGIC 4 also makes possible the i-Contrast (Intelligent Contrast Correction) system, which controls the compensation level in pixel units to brighten dark areas while leaving bright areas unchanged for better images where the main subject is dark, and more natural transition. The PowerShot SD780 IS Digital ELPH can even use i-Contrast in playback mode to adjust images that were shot without the setting activated. 

Red-eye Correction provides three options for removing red-eye from subjects in flash pictures.
1) Red-eye Correction during shooting actually identifies and corrects red-eye in human subjects as pictures are taken.
2) The PowerShot SD780 IS Digital ELPH can be set to automatically detect and correct red-eye during image playback.
3) You can manually locate any red eyes in a scene during image playback on the LCD screen, and command the camera to remove them. 

Life doesn’t give you second chances to capture special times. That’s why the PowerShot SD780 IS Digital ELPH features an ISO 1600 setting that reduces the effects of camera shake and sharpens subjects in low-light situations, giving you greater shooting flexibility. ISO can be expanded to 3200 when you select ISO 3200 Special Scene mode.

 * Battery charger (CB-2LV) 
 * Wrist strap (WS-DC7) 
 * Digital Camera Solution CD-ROM 
 * USB interface cable (IFC-400PCU) 
 * AV cable (AVC-DC400)
